TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content: Okay then. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
Does the forum have an XML/JSON/etc. API for programmatic access to the content of threads?

> 
> 
> 11 hours ago, HebaruSan said:
> 
> 
> Does the forum have an XML/JSON/etc. API for programmatic access to the content of threads?
> 

Sure. I mean, no. Uh.... maybe? What is that? 

[@ManeTI](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/167672-maneti/)?
Why we can't delete replies or topics?

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, Jeb, The Lonely Kerbonaut said:
> 
> 
> Why we can't delete replies or topics?
> 

So people don't post rule-breaking stuff and then erase the evidence.

> 
> 
> 16 minutes ago, Vanamonde said:
> 
> 
> So people don't post rule-breaking stuff and then erase the evidence.
> 

Well, i understand now.

I’m noticing a blue line in between [@Jeb, The Lonely Kerbonaut](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/180473-jeb-the-lonely-kerbonaut/)‘s and Vanamonde’s post (the one posted 18 hours before this one). It doesn’t seem occurring anywhere else. What does it mean?

> 
> 
> 2 minutes ago, RA3236 said:
> 
> 
> I’m noticing a blue line in between [@Jeb, The Lonely Kerbonaut](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/180473-jeb-the-lonely-kerbonaut/)‘s and Vanamonde’s post (the one posted 18 hours before this one). It doesn’t seem occurring anywhere else. What does it mean?
> 

Usually that's how the forum separates read and unread posts.

> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, HebaruSan said:
> 
> 
> Usually that's how the forum separates read and unread posts.
> 

Ah ok, that makes more sense now that I see it above yours ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)").

[@Jeb, The Lonely Kerbonaut](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/180473-jeb-the-lonely-kerbonaut/) If you want something of yours removed, click the "report post" button to let us know, and include something like "please remove." We'll do our best to help.
Ok.

I'd like to suggest adding SOP (Standard Operating Procedure) to the mouseover definitions please.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-01-12T02:49:57Z" title="01/12/2018 02:49  AM" data-short="6 yr">January 12, 2018</time> by StrandedonEarth**
If a thread gets posted in, say, KSP Discussion, then gets moved to The Lounge, do our post counts get decremented, as if they had originally been posted in The Lounge (where they don't count)?
A quick test I just ran indicates that no, your post count is not decremented.

Inflation: like Bitcoin, early adopters of the rep system saw their first gains exponentially multiply, before the Great Crash of 2013...
Can we get the "Which information should your support request have" thing on all the technical support subforums? So many people ask for support without providing logs, specs, or mod list.

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Jas0n said:
> 
> 
> Can we get the "Which information should your support request have" thing on all the technical support subforums? So many people ask for support without providing logs, specs, or mod list.
> 

Stickied posts don't seem to work, either, for the forums that already have them. What's really needed is a template that shows up in the box whenever you start a new post in that forum.

My question is: are the moderators rewarded for their service to this great community?

I know you pplz work hard to keep the forum safe and civil and I would like to know if there is a patreon or paypal account I could donate to so you guys and gals can have a drink on me?

> 
> 
> 8 hours ago, HebaruSan said:
> 
> 
> Stickied posts don't seem to work, either, for the forums that already have them. What's really needed is a template that shows up in the box whenever you start a new post in that forum.
> 

Or better yet, an actual submission form with all fields required.

> 
> 
> 8 hours ago, James Kerman said:
> 
> 
> My question is: are the moderators rewarded for their service to this great community?
> 

It's actually pretty rewarding on itself.

But, no, we don't have any donation channel set-up. Individuals might have, but I wouldn't ask for donations for *myself* for doing this.

If I'm ever around you, tho, I'll give you a call and charge that beer ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")
yeah, if [@Jebediah Kerman](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/109744-jebediah-kerman/) has only 2 likes, how did he get all that rep?

> 
> 
> 22 minutes ago, DAL59 said:
> 
> 
> yeah, if [@Jebediah Kerman](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/109744-jebediah-kerman/) has only 2 likes, how did he get all that rep?
> 

By actually going to space!

I have no idea where to put this, or if it justifies its own thread, so I put it here. Starting Yesterday, I can no longer access my notifications. The circle spins indefinitely. If I click on "show all notifications", it says that the page is unavailable. Mail/Messaging still works however.
